title: Embroidery Digitizing & Etsy Creative Assistant Wilcom Hatch & Illustrator
job_overview:
Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8 PM to 4 AM EST
(This will be flexible down the road)

While this role is focused on digitizing and Etsy creative work, you will initially be trained in Amazon product research and spend most of your time on that during the early phase. We are in the process of launching our Etsy embroidery shop and testing niche concepts, but our current operations are focused on Amazon online arbitrage (OA). OA involves finding profitable products on retail websites to resell on Amazon or Walmart. You’ll be trained in product sourcing using tools like Keepa and SellerAmp, while gradually transitioning into embroidery-related work.

Your future role will focus more on:

* Creating digitized embroidery files using Wilcom Hatch
* Preparing graphics in Adobe Illustrator
* Supporting Etsy listing creation and product mockups
* Contributing to niche and design research
* Etsy Seo

---

Requirements

* Fluent in English (written and spoken)
* Experienced in Wilcom Hatch (manual digitizing, underlay/pull comp, trims, small text handling)
* Skilled in Adobe Illustrator
* Strong attention to detail and time management
* Time Doctor must be installed and active during your shift
* You must not currently work for another Amazon, Walmart, or Etsy seller

---

 To apply, send:

* Resume in PDF format
* Screenshot of your Cloudflare Speed Test
* Voice or video recording answering the questions below
* Bonus points: Attach embroidery files you’ve digitized (.EMB + preview image) or mockups/listings you've created.

---

 Voice or Video Recording – Answer These Questions:

1. What embroidery digitizing tools do you use? Describe your skill level in Wilcom Hatch.
2. What types of embroidery designs have you worked on (text-based, icons, dense fills, hats, babywear, etc.)?
3. Have you worked with Etsy embroidery shops before? What was your role?
4. How do you ensure your digitized files are clean, production-ready, and machine-optimized?
5. Describe your experience using Illustrator for design prep, product art, or mockups.
6. How would you feel working on Amazon/Walmart OA tasks while the embroidery side of our Etsy shop is still growing?
7. What steps would you take to stay productive and organized across OA tasks and embroidery/digitizing work?
8. Share a time when you had to learn a new tool or creative process quickly. What was the outcome?
9. What motivates you when working independently on creative or repetitive tasks?

---

You’ll be contacted with an interview link if your application passes our initial screening.
